critique: This document is a recommendation for the appointment of Mrs. A. Louise Gilbert to a position in the Bureau of Agricultural Economics of the Department of Agriculture, without regard to civil service rules. The rationale is that she is the widow of a deceased employee who died in an accident during an official trip. This appears to be a compassionate measure to support the widow of a government employee. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power implications, federalism concerns, national security vs. civil liberties issues, economic regulation aspects, or social inclusion considerations. The document seems to be a specific case of providing employment to a widow of a deceased employee. Therefore, most axes should be scored as neutral.
